commentable_entity.ask: Remove Amber Heard from Future Warner Bros Projects
commentable_entity.title: Remove Amber Heard from Future Warner Bros Projects
commentable_entity.description:
In light of the recent controversy surrounding the court case against Amber Heard brought by Johnny Depp, I believe it is time to recast Mira in the DC Extended Universe and for any future appearances to be made by a said character in any other related projects by Warner Brothers Studios. 

The Grounds.
In light of the growing negativity around Amber Heard, we feel that the image of the studio and its projects are being negatively affected to the extent that fans are now planning to boycott the upcoming Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom, which features Ms Heard in a somewhat prominent role. The potential loss of revenue will undoubtedly make a large dent in the studio's income for the year and negatively impact other project budgets down the line. 

Fair Play
Given the reaction that the studio had toward Mr Depp regarding 'allegations' brought against him by Ms Heard, prior to any court proceedings to prove or disprove the said allegation. We feel that the following the court proceedings, currently in motion, along with the witness testimonies and evidence presented which strongly motivate the public to back Depp as the victim rather than the abuser, the studio must now act against Ms Heard is a similar manner to which it acted against Mr Depp.

Public Opinion
As indicated by the earlier poll set forth on change.org to remove Ms Heard from Aquaman 2, general public opinion shifting away from her, and mounting threats by the public to boycott both the Aquaman sequel and any and all Warner Bros projects, the situation could grow rather dire for the studio. 

We feel it is in the studio's best interest that it terminate its association with Ms Heard as soon as possible, should it wish to continue being profitable in the near future and beyond.
commentable_entity.letter_body: Remove Amber Heard from Future Warner Bros Projects
